title: Susumu Yokota Discography [1993 - 2009]
description:
Susumu Yokota Discography (1993 - 2009)

Susumu Yokota is an electronic artist from Japan and widely accepted as one of the most talented composers and producers in electronic music today. His roots are in house and techno, DJing at events like ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œI Love TechnoÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½ in the early 90ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s. Over the years his music has progressed into ambient and ambient-techno genres. He became quite famous around 2000-2001. Today, his discography includes some 30+ albums, encompassing 7 or 8 different genres of electronic music within them. On his most wellknown albums he uses spinning samples of piano, voice, guitar and rhythmic components to create a musical landscape filled with everchanging moods and complex songstructure.

His best albums are said to be: ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œSymbolÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½ where he used samples of classical music pieces, melodies from vivaldi, shostakovich, mahler, albinoni are found within it, ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œSakuraÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½ (LEAF 2000) ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œGrinning CatÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½ (LEAF 2001), ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œThe Boy and the treeÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½ (LEAF 2002) and his last CD (with Vocals) ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œWonder WaltzÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½ (LO 2006). On ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œWonder WaltzÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½ he co-operated with Czech avant-garde violinist and singer Iva BittovÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â¡.
